title.rendered: See the 2016 Ford GT in This Walkaround

content.rendered: The new Ford GT was introduced at the North American Auto Show earlier this year. Ford wants to race the car in the 2016 24 Hour of Le Mans to mark the 50th anniversary of its last win in 1966. Rumors say the V6 engine will make more than 600 horsepower and reach 60 mph from a dead stop in around three seconds. They’re only planning on building 200 units in 2016, so act fast if you want to grab one. You just need about $400,000.

facebook_message: All I need is 400k and this baby is all mine.

title.rendered: This Off-Roader Can Drive Through Walls and Survive Explosions

content.rendered: This monster of a vehicle is nearly unstoppable. Known as the Marauder, it’s got a six cylinder turbo diesel engine and it’s nearly 40,000 pounds when fully loaded but can get up to 75 mph. That’s not bad. I wonder what kind of gas mileage it gets.

facebook_message: I'm sure Arnold Schwarzenegger has already special ordered his.

title.rendered: This Rich Kid Trades His Lamborghini for a Stranger’s Ford Fusion

content.rendered: This kid gets compliments on his Lamborghini so often that he decides to give the car to the first person to compliment it. He just grabs a quick picture of the guy’s license plate, gets his phone number and lets the guy take his Lambo for the day. “You might need to pump some gas in it but other than that it’s good,” he says before trading keys with a random guy at a gas station.

title.rendered: Man Builds Wooden Cars and They’re Works of Art

content.rendered: Meet Isaac Cohen. He’s an artist that makes completely street-legal, custom cars made out of wood. Cohen’s website boasts that he’s been making custom pieces with wood, furniture and otherwise, for 35 years. One of the cars is even aptly named Splinter.

title.rendered: Cop Asks Biker to Pop a Wheelie Then Tries to Bust Him!

content.rendered:
This anonymous motorcyclist was cruising down I-75/I-85 through Atlanta (alt_d stomping grounds) when an Atlanta PD cruiser gave him the universal signal for “Do a Wheelie.” So he busts one and the cop suddenly decides to pull him over. Take it from us, APD is fun like that.

As soon as the cop’s lights come on, the biker wastes no time leaving that cop in the dust! Georgia highways are bad enough without bikers running illegal lane splitting, but we can’t argue with out-running a cop who tricked you into a ticket!

title.rendered: Girl Eats Cement After Facing Jumbo Jet Takeoff

content.rendered: St. Marteen International Airport is known for having a runway across the street from a populated beach. Tourists in the area love to try holding their position when a jet lands or takes off because the force it produces knocks them around. These people are all clinging to a fence to try and withstand the jet taking off in front of them. The girl that tries to hold on the longest, well, it doesn’t work out too well for her…

title.rendered: Insane (and Talented) Driver on a Public Road

content.rendered:
Sloane: What are we gonna do?
Ferris: The question isn’t “what are we going to do,” the question is “what aren’t we going to do”?
Cameron: Please don’t say we’re not gonna take the car home. Please don’t say we’re not gonna take the car home. Please don’t say we’re not gonna take the car home.
Ferris: [to the home audience]If you had access to a car like this, would you take it back right away? Neither would I.

~ Ferris Bueller’s Day Off

title.rendered: Carjack Fail

content.rendered: This footage is of a carjacking foiled by an idiot and a manual transmission. The crook pulls a gun on the car owner and jumps in the driver’s seat. This is when the panic sets in…it’s a stick-shift. The truck is jerking and rocking like prom night. He finally gives up and bails. The moral of this story is, if you plan to steal a car, please know how to drive it.

title.rendered: Huge Python Under the Hood (20 Feet)

content.rendered: My grandmother dragged me on safari with her singles group. Things were pretty lame until this freaking huge ass snake crawled up in Barbara Ann’s car. They were handing out fresh Depends left and right. Best trip ever. Thanks, Nana.

title.rendered: BMW Driver Blocks Ambulance, Gets Out to Fight on the Highway

content.rendered: Where is the logic here? The BMW driver is upset that an ambulance slowed him down, so he decides to race ahead, block the ambulance, and then get out of his car to have an argument, which only makes him that much later! After a few harsh words (we assume) are exchanged in Russian, the driver climbs back in his douche-wagon, flips a quick bird, and then speeds away. This guy has just reinforced the entitled BMW driver stereotype.

title.rendered: Buy Your Own Street Legal Tron Cycle

content.rendered: Parker Brothers Concepts in Melbourne, Fl have created a street legal, electric Tron Cycle. With a top speed of 100mph and 80 miles on a charge, the starting price of $55,000 seems reasonable. We can’t wait to see these on the road. The one in the video appears to be a police bike. Is there C.H.I.P.S 2016 reboot in the making?

title.rendered: This Chevelle’s Tires Blow at More Than 150 MPH

content.rendered: This Chevelle’s tires blew during qualifying at the Ozark Raceway Park Street Machine Shootout. “The nitrous system stayed on and the front brakes locked up on it. I don’t know what happened,” says the driver. That was a close call.

excerpt.rendered: This Chevelle’s tires blew during qualifying at the Ozark Raceway Park Street Machine Shootout. “The nitrous system stayed on and the front brakes locked up on it. I don’t know what happened,” says the driver. That was a close call.

title.rendered: Criminal Pits Cop Before Crashing

content.rendered: During an extremely dangerous high speed chase, this criminal pulled some moves against the Houston police department! He’s being chased down the highway by cruisers and SUVs when he comes up on an officer’s car and sends him into the median wall! The cruiser tumbled end-over-end like a stunt from a movie. The suspect eventually is over-taken by another officer who barrels into him.

title.rendered: Man Flees Police Chase on Skateboard…Is Stopped By Reality TV Star

content.rendered: It’s a typical car chase in Los Angeles, California until the suspect hops out of the car and hops onto a longboard. As funny as that is, he’s then stopped by a former reality show star from the cancelled truTV series “Operation Repo.” Luis Pizarro told reporters, “It’s just instinct just to, you know, block the guy off.”

title.rendered: The Perfect Response When You are Almost Run Over

content.rendered:
This helmet cam footage comes to us from the Grimsel Pass in Switzerland. This biker was cruising along, minding his own business on a sunny drive when he was nearly hit by oncoming traffic. The car in question was trying to pass a slower driver and didn’t see this biker in the other lane. So what’s the proper way to let them know you acknowledge their inability to drive safely?

Well, it’s just this one simple gesture.

title.rendered: The Monowheel

content.rendered: We’re not entirely certain who came up with this, but we love it! It’s called the Monowheel and is something out of a Twisted Metal game or a Mad Max movie. It handles acceleration and deceleration like a motorcycle and uses the driver’s body leaning to turn. It may not be the most useful “vehicle” to drive, but it’s definitely one of the most unique!

title.rendered: The Chainsaw Motorcycle

content.rendered: Leave it to the Germans to find new and creative ways to craft custom engines! This incredible chainsaw motorcycle is powered by 24 separate chainsaws! Sure, it takes a few minutes to fire the whole thing up, but once it gets going it commands attention!

category.name: Motorcycles
category.description: Vehicles on four wheels aren't the only ones out on the road. We collect stories about these two-wheel beasts here.

title.rendered: Homemade Supercharged Straight Eight Engine!

content.rendered: Chris Ireland created this monster in his own shed! He began by fusing two NSU engines and finished it off by throwing a supercharger on top! It took six months of determination, sweat, and a lot of frustration, but he finished it! Check it out as he fires it up for the first time!

category.name: Gearhead
category.description: If you're the educational type who likes D.I.Y. content and "Top" lists, you'll get your fill here.

title.rendered: Can You Bring a Semi Back From The Dead?

content.rendered: Ryder has challenged itself by starting “Project Rebirth.” They’re aiming to completely destroy a semi then build it back from the ground up. They’ve taken a modern Volvo semi rig and run it through a gauntlet of destruction. Once the truck has been pronounced completely dead, they move the remains to a Ryder facility and give them only 24 hours to bring it back to life!

title.rendered: Tank Rolls Over a Bomb Like a Boss

content.rendered: The US M1 Abrams Tank is one beast of a war machine. It rolls over a bomb and barely flinches. Watch as it drives over an IED hidden beneath an abandoned car.

category.name: Grab Bag
category.description: Random, sometimes shocking, and usually for the lulz

title.rendered: Get Scared Into Always Wearing Your Seat Belt

content.rendered:
People still like to complain about having to wear seat belts. Sure, they can be uncomfortable or leave bruises if you are in an accident; however, the alternative is far worse!

Just watch this ’98 Expedition Rollover crash test video. Take a look at what happens to bodies inside a vehicle who aren’t strapped in. As this car, any car for that matter, spins and flips all over the road you can see how easily a human body can fly out the window and even land in the path of the crash!

facebook_message: If this doesn't convince you to wear a seat belt then nothing will!
